markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Adopted Ancestry](/Feats.aspx?ID=5115) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="General" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=78" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 252 <sup>2.0</sup>

_[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society) The Adopted Ancestry feat can only be used to select common ancestries or ancestries which all Pathfinder agents have access to (such as kobolds)._

</column>

---

You’re fully immersed in another ancestry’s culture and traditions, whether born into them, earned through rite of passage, or bonded through a deep friendship or romance. Choose a common ancestry or another ancestry to which you have access. You can select ancestry feats from the ancestry you chose, in addition to your character’s own ancestry, as long as the ancestry feats don’t require any physiological feature that you lack, as determined by the GM.
name: Adopted Ancestry

</summary>

text: <title level="1" right="Feat 1" pfs="Standard" > Adopted Ancestry Source Player Core pg. 252 2.0 PFS Note The Adopted Ancestry feat can only be used to select common ancestries or ancestries which all Pathfinder agents have access to (such as kobolds). --- You’re fully immersed in another ancestry’s culture and traditions, whether born into them, earned through rite of passage, or bonded through a deep friendship or romance. Choose a common ancestry or another ancestry to which you have access. You can select ancestry feats from the ancestry you chose, in addition to your character’s own ancestry, as long as the ancestry feats don’t require any physiological feature that you lack, as determined by the GM.
